comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Re DATE - see archivesoutside.records.nsw.gov.au/can-you-date-this-phot... After 1903 when the Loftus Street / Pitt Street tramway loop opened. Before 1905 when the Colonial Sugar Co. offices were built (seen in the later Kerry photo above) or - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2780552800/] So far ...

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: OK - it looks like a c.1904 date is the conclsuion on this one. Thanks for everyones input!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The very old building with the big tree (just seen here), which preceded the Colonial Sugar Co. Offices was this - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... . At the corner of O'Connell and Bent Streets. According to these two photos it was Mr Balcombe's House - First Colonial Treasurer, built 1820s acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=154751 acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=189430
